get.summary: Get the list of AW Contents.

parameters.name: queryString
parameters.description: Searches for the string value in the File Name.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Category being queried.

parameters.name: expiresIn
parameters.description: Filter by Contents that are going to expire within days specified.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by what column, it accepts "Name", "Size", "Author", "DownloadPriority", "IsRequired", "IsActive", "EffectiveDate", "ExpirationDate", "ModifiedOn", or "ModifiedBy". By default it sorts by "Name".

parameters.name: sortAscending
parameters.description: Sort direction. By default it sorts Ascending.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results returned per Page.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: File name along with the Extension

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: Effective Date for the file being uploaded

get.summary: Download a file
Gets a file metadata.
Get all cateogries available for this OG

post.summary: Create new category under OG specified

delete.summary: Endpoint to delete a category specified by the Id

get.summary: New - gets the content gateway configurations
get.description: It returns all the content gateway configurations such as the platform in which the content gateway is configured and the ports to which requests are to be forwarded.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: locationgroup id for which contentgateway configurations are needed(Required)

post.summary: New - gets the content gateway configurations and the certificate details
post.description: It returns a content gateway configuration such as the platform in which the content gateway is configured and the port to which requests are to be forwarded.

parameters.name: contentGatewayConfigurationId
parameters.description: content gateway configuration id for which contentgateway configurations are needed(Required)

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password with which the certificate details are got(Required)

post.summary: New - Creates a Content Gateway Configuration
post.description: It creates a content gateway configuration for the specific platform for which content gateway needs to be configured

parameters.name: ContentGatewayV1Model
parameters.description: Content gateway configuration details to be created(Required)

get.summary: Get the list of Files and Folders.

parameters.name: queryString
parameters.description: Searches for the string value in the File or Folder Name.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Folder being queried. If the Folder ID is not provided, the Contents at the Root Level are displayed.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: Filter contents by Mime Type. If querying for Folders, use 'AW.Folder'.

parameters.name: includeTrashed
parameters.description: Include Content that has already been moved to the Trash Folder.

parameters.name: isShared
parameters.description: Filter by shared contents. If set to 'TRUE', only Shared Content is returned.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description: Filter by Content that has been modified on or after the specified Date.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results returned per Page.

put.summary: Update file metadata (name, description, notes and subject)

get.summary: Getting sharing info on a file if you are the owner.

post.summary: Create a shared link for a file.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Model binder containing optional share parameters

delete.summary: Remove sharing on a file if you are the owner.

post.summary:
Simple upload is the straightforward approach to upload a file to AirWatch Database.
Used if Rfs isn not configured and the file is relatively small.
Also it's the best approach to use if you want to send file metadata along with file binary in the same request.
<example>
Sample request header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=CUSTOM_BOUNDARY".
Sample request body "CUSTOM_BOUNDARY
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="fileMetadata"
Content-Type: application/json
{"Title":"Pic1.jpg", "Description":"First upload attempt"}
CUSTOM_BOUNDARY
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="fileBinary"; filename="Pic1.jpg"
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Content-Length: 23548
.... file binary here ....
CUSTOM_BOUNDARY"
</example>

Simple upload is the straightforward approach to upload a file to AirWatch Database.
Used if Rfs isn not configured and the file is relatively small.
Also it's the best approach to use if you want to send file metadata along with file binary in the same request.
<example>
Sample request header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=CUSTOM_BOUNDARY".
Sample request body "CUSTOM_BOUNDARY
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="fileMetadata"
Content-Type: application/json
{"Title":"Pic1.jpg", "Description":"First upload attempt"}
CUSTOM_BOUNDARY
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="fileBinary"; filename="Pic1.jpg"
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Content-Length: 23548
.... file binary here ....
CUSTOM_BOUNDARY"
</example>

<para>
            Explicit upload is the approach that you can use to upload big files to Rfs. Also you have to update the metadata of the file in a separate request.
            Explicit upload can be done by 3 steps:
            - Initalize step: Initialize the upload operation by sending file name, size, folder id (optional), server will respond with upload url and finalize url.
            - Upload step: Upload the physical file using upload url you've gotten from the server. Hence, you will get the file hash in this step.
            - Finalize step: Expose Finalize url after substituting hash place holder '$hash$' with the actual hash you've gotten in step# 2.
            </para>
            This is the Initialize step endpoint, you will get Rfs Upload Url and Finalize Url from this step.
            It's recommended that callers should follow above steps to upload successfully.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: File name along with the Extension

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Which folder you want to upload the file inside it, Root folder is the default

post.summary:
<para>
            Explicit upload is the approach that you can use to upload big files to Rfs. Also you have to update the metadata of the file in a separate request.
            Explicit upload can be done by 3 steps:
            - Initalize step: Initialize the upload operation by sending file name, size, folder id (optional), server will respond with upload url and finalize url.
            - Upload step: Upload the physical file using upload url you've gotten from the server. Hence, you will get the file hash in this step.
            - Finalize step: Expose Finalize url after substituting hash place holder '$hash$' with the actual hash you've gotten in step# 2.
            </para>
            This is the Finalize step endpoint, when you expose it successfully, you should see the file in the personal content repository.
            It's recommended that callers should follow above steps to upload successfully.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: File name along with the Extension

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Which folder you want to upload the file inside it, Root folder is the default

parameters.name: externalFileID
parameters.description: External file id for the file you've uploaded it to Rfs

parameters.name: externalFileHash
parameters.description: External file hash for the file you've uploaded it to Rfs

get.summary: Get Folder info / metadata

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for the Folder being queried

get.summary: Get Folder info / metadata

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for the Folder being queried

patch.summary: Move a Folder to the destination folder given in the request

get.summary: Returns sharing metadata for the folder

put.summary:
Update Collaborators of shared folder. 
This end point will add/update/delete the collaborators.
It expects the complete want to update/add collaborators list as input. 
Will delete the collaborators which are not in input list.

parameters.name: folderShareInfoModel
parameters.description: info of collaborators for folder sharing

post.summary:
Share a Folder with Users or UserGroups.
The API expects User Id or User Group Id, Role and Type to share accordingly.
If no userid present and emailid is mentioned then the user is considered to be external userid.  
This end point accepts the collaborators list and shares the folder to them assuming that 
the folder is not shared to anyone else yet.

delete.summary: Remove sharing on folder if you are the owner. Otherwise, leave the folder.

get.summary: Gets the prospective collaborators list for the given folder

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: Searches for the string value in collaborator name

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter search results by collaborator type User or Group

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results returned per Page

put.summary:
Updates a Collaborator. You can only update Role of the Collaborator.
The API expects User Id or User Group Id, Role and Type to share accordingly.
If no userid present and emailid is mentioned then the user is considered to be external userid.

parameters.name: folderShareInfoModel
parameters.description: info for folder sharing in which role to update is mentioned

delete.summary: Remove one or more collaborators from a shared folder. The currently authenticated user must have Edit Share Permission.

parameters.name: deletedCollaboratorModels
parameters.description: List of collaborators to be deleted

contentId.description: Gets or sets the Unique Identifier for the File or Folder

parentId.description: Gets or sets the Unique Identifier for the Folder that contains the File or Folder

name.description: Gets or sets the name of the File or Folder

mimeType.description: Gets or sets the MIME type of the File being queried. If a Folder is queried, 'aw.folder' is returned

sharingRole.description: Gets or sets the User's sharing rights for the queried File Folder ("Owner", "Co-Owner", "Editor", "Reader")

owner.description: Gets or sets the owner of folder or file

isFavorite.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this item is favorite or not. Returns 'True' if the File or Folder has been marked as a Favorite

isTrashed.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this item is trashed or not. Returns 'True' if the File or Folder has been trashed

isShared.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this item is shared or not. Returns 'True' if the File or Folder has been shared with other Users

downloadMethod.description: Gets or sets the download method selected for the File or Folder being queried ('Wifi Only' or 'Any'). This feature is only available at the Parent Folder Level and in conjunction with the Content Locker App

downloadWhileRoaming.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this item can be downloaded while roaming or not. Returns 'True' if the File or Folder being queried is allowed to be downloaded while on Data Roaming. This feature is only available at the Parent Folder Level and in conjunction with the Content Locker App

forceEncryption.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this item is force encrypted or not. Returns 'True' if client side encryption has been enabled. This feature is only available at the Parent Folder Level and in conjunction with the Content Locker App

subject.description: Gets or sets the subject of the file. This parameter is not applicable for Folders

downloadLink.description: Gets or sets the download URL of the file. This parameter is not applicable for Folders

size.description: Gets or sets the size of file or folder

createdOn.description: Gets or sets the date and time when the File or Folder was created

modifiedOn.description: Gets or sets the date and time when the File or Folder was last modified

hash.description: The SHA1 hash of the blob.
